intro: Bromus dissitiflorus, commonly known as the scattered-flower brome, is a grass species native to South America. It is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences with pale green to brownish spikelets. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Bromus dissitiflorus is often found in open grasslands and disturbed sites, thriving in temperate climates.
